metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: The purpose of an AppML controller , is to let you control your application.
content.html: The purpose of an AppML controller, is to let you control your application.

content.text: By default AppML applications run without a controller:
content.html: By default AppML applications run without a controller:

content.code_html:
<table appml-data="customers.js">
<tr>
  <th>Customer</th>
  <th>City</th>
  <th>Country</th>
</tr>
<tr appml-repeat="records">
  <td>{{CustomerName}}</td>
  <td>{{City}}</td>
  <td>{{Country}}</td>
</tr>
</table>

content.text: With an AppML controller, you can control your application with JavaScript .
content.html: With an AppML controller, you can control your application with JavaScript.

content.text: The controller is a JavaScript function, provided by you .
content.html: The controller is a JavaScript function, provided by you.

content.text: The appml-controller attribute is used to refer to a controller function.
content.html: The appml-controller attribute is used to refer to a controller function.

content.code:
Customers

                               
CustomerCityCountry
{{CustomerName}}{{City}}{{Country}}
content.code_html:
<h1>Customers</h1>
<table appml-data="customers.js" appml-controller="myController">
  <tr>
    <th>Customer</th>
    <th>City</th>
    <th>Country</th>
  </tr>
  <tr appml-repeat="records">
    <td>{{CustomerName}}</td>
    <td>{{City}}</td>
    <td>{{Country}}</td>
  </tr>
</table>

<script>
function myController($appml) {
    if ($appml.message == "display") {
        if ($appml.display.name == "CustomerName") {
            $appml.display.value = $appml.display.value.toUpperCase();
        }
    }
}
</script>

content.text: The controller (myController) in the example above, changes the value of "CustomerName" to uppercase, before it is displayed.
content.html: The controller (myController) in the example above, changes the value of "CustomerName" to uppercase, before it is displayed.

content.text: If you have a controller, AppML will send the application object ($appml) to the controller, for every important action.
content.html: If you have a controller, AppML will send the application object ($appml) to the controller, for every important action.

content.text: One of the application properties is a message ($appml.message), describing the application state.
content.html: One of the application properties is a message ($appml.message), describing the application state.

content.code_html:
Message Description
ready Sent after AppML is initiated, and ready to load data.
loaded Sent after AppML is fully loaded, ready to display data.
display Sent before AppML displays a data item.
done Sent after AppML is done (finished displaying).
submit Sent before AppML submits data.
error Sent after AppML has encountered an error.

content.text: Messages are explained in the next chapter.
content.html: Messages are explained in the next chapter.
